definition: out of tune/off-key
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)
to harmonize/to reconcile/to blend/to suit well/to adjust/to regulate/to season (food)/to provoke/to incite
to transfer/to move (troops or cadres)/to investigate/to enquire into/accent/view/argument/key (in music)/mode (music)/tune/tone/melody

sentences.english: The piano is badly out of tune and jangles on my ears.
sentences.chinese: 这架钢琴走调走得厉害，让我觉得非常刺耳。

sentences.english: The violin seems to be out of tune.
sentences.chinese: 这把小提琴好像走调了。

sentences.english: Don't butcher that song by singing off key .
sentences.chinese: 别唱走调而糟蹋了那首歌。

sentences.english: That tall boy seemed to be out of tune.
sentences.chinese: 那位高个男孩好像走调了。

sentences.english: He cannot carry even a simple tune .
sentences.chinese: 他唱个简单曲子都走调儿。

sentences.english: None of them could sing in tune.
sentences.chinese: 他唱个简单曲子都走调儿。

sentences.english: In time a violin goes out of tune , and sounds awful.
sentences.chinese: 过一段时间以后，小提琴就会走调儿，而且声音难听。

sentences.english: The choir was distinctly out of tune in places.
sentences.chinese: 合唱团有些地方明显走调了。

definition: to be off-key or out of tune (while singing) (colloquial)
off-key/out of tune (music)
tone deaf/unable to sing in tune
high pitch/soprano/treble
tone deaf
to sing/to call loudly/to chant
to sing a song
falsetto, same as 假聲|假声
singing style/singing method
falsetto/opposite: natural or true voice 真聲|真声[zhen1 sheng1]
tone sandhi/modified tone/(music) to change key/modulation
to pronounce (clearly or otherwise)/to enunciate
to sing opera music (without staging or make up)
to accompany (musically)
to sing and play (plucked string instrument)
to lip-sync (singing)
